channel.title: INtech
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from INtech, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Microplastics Could Be Weakening Your Bones, Research Suggests
item.description: The review of more than 60 scientific articles showed that microplastics, among other effects, can stimulate the formation of osteoclasts, cells speci...

item.title: OpenAI Adds Parental Safety Controls for Teen ChatGPT Users. Here’s What to Expect
item.description: OpenAI’s review process for teenage ChatGPT users who are flagged for suicidal ideation includes human moderators. Parents can expect an alert about a...

item.title: The AI services transformation may be harder than VCs think
item.description: Early warning signs suggest this whole services-industry metamorphosis may be more complicated than VCs anticipate.

item.title: Marissa Mayer Is Dissolving Her Sunshine Startup Lab
item.description: After seven rocky years, the company’s assets will be sold to Dazzle, a new AI firm that Mayer founded.

item.title: 11 Best Coffee Subscriptions (2025), Tested by Caffeine Hounds
item.description: These services deliver freshly roasted, delicious coffee picks right to your door—each with its own twist.

item.title: Tile Tracking Tags Can Be Exploited by Tech-Savvy Stalkers, Researchers Say
item.description: A team of researchers found that, by not encrypting the data broadcast by Tile tags, users could be vulnerable to having their location information ex...

item.title: Paid, the AI agent ‘results-based billing’ startup from Manny Medina, raises huge $21M seed
item.description: Paid offers an interesting contribution to the AI agentic world: a platform for so-called "results-based" billing.

item.title: DJI loses lawsuit over classification as Chinese military company
item.description: A federal judge has rejected drone maker DJI’s efforts to get off a Department of Defense list of Chinese military companies.

item.title: Oura CEO talks potential IPO and ‘nonnegotiable’ data privacy
item.description: In a recent interview with The New York Times, Oura Health CEO Tom Hale didn’t discuss reports that the company is raising new funding that would valu...

item.title: The billion-dollar infrastructure deals powering the AI boom
item.description: Here's everything we know about the biggest AI infrastructure projects, including major spending from Meta, Oracle, Microsoft, Google, and OpenAI.
